author: jimmygchen
content: Just to add to that, I think there might be a bit more changes on the builder/relayer side if the decision changes after it goes live, as it will likely impact the builder flow (e.g. if blobs are decoupled and required to be signed, I'm guessing `getBlindedBlock` response may have to include blobs so validator can sign?). Probably not a concern and I could be wrong but thought it's worth bringing up

author: m.kalinin
content: Validator could sign off on blobs after receiving a block with blobs from a relayer. If we want relayers to be capable of disseminating blobs then validator can sign off on them in advance by receiving blob root/roots via new `getBlindBlockAndBlobs` method

author: m.kalinin
content: It might be the case that engineering complexity of decoupling isn't too high to leave it as a technical debt. If decoupled dissemination proves to be efficient enough to take the complexity we might better to it from the beginning as any debt may result in implicit dependencies that are complex to overcome in later upgrades

author: bridge-bot
content:
<asn_d6> <@555483069038198827> wrt your crypto decoupling PR #3236: when would we use `verify_blob_kzg_proof_multi()`?

like we would use `verify_blob_kzg_proof()` when we receive a sidecar with a single blob which will happen all the time.

but when would we have multiple blobs at once so that we can use the multi() verification? during... sync? or opportunistically if we get two blobs at the same time? or what?

author: jimmygchen
content: Thanks <@425572898787426305>  - if I'm not mistaken we’re talking about similar things (I think*). The earlier proposal (https://hackmd.io/a8eyJ505Q62gXMbYr0v7_w?view#Block-Proposal---Builder-flow)  was to have the relayer return the blobs as part of the `submitBlindedBlock` response (revealed payload + blobs), so that beacon node can broadcast the signed block and blobs (also done by relayer). but now if blobs need to be signed then validator will need the blobs in advance via the new `getBlindBlockAndBlobs` method like you suggested. I guess we could consider having validator sign off the blobs in advance regardless of whether blocks and blobs are decoupled, so there's less additional changes on the relayer / builder side if the decision is to decouple the blobs later? do you see any downside to this? Is there any concerns with revealing the blobs in advance?
